caption: A lovely monument to visit, very respectful environment for the tomb of the unknown soldier. The steps to the top could be challenging for some, but worth the effort for the views from the terrace. We booked tickets online beforehand so there was no wait. Strongly recommend this unless you like queues.

Repurchased tickets.  Easy security check and ticket scan. Approximately 200 steps to first level, 25 more to top. Steps are well kept with a very nice railing to make the climb easier, even for those with height issues. Beautiful views of all of Paris! Tomb of the unknown soldier is well kept and protected at the base

I cannot begin to describe how beautiful this place is! Such an important piece of history, and what a great view of the city. The museum inside is pretty informative too, and makes sure that there isn‚Äôt too much boring information that just drags you along. The view of the city would have been better had there been blue skies, but no one can control that so it doesn‚Äôt impact it too much

Great place to spend time and visit. Very near to metro station, bus stands. You can go to the top of the arc structure  via stairs and can enjoy the city view. As the arc is almost at the center of the city, you can get a very wide and distant view of the complete city. To reach under the arch take the under passes, do not cross the roads as there are no crosswalks and the traffic flows continuously. Hope you  have good time.

The Arc de Triomphe is an absolute must-visit when in Paris! The monument itself is breathtaking, with its intricate carvings and grand structure standing as a powerful symbol of history and culture. Climbing to the top is well worth it‚Äî the panoramic views of Paris are simply stunning, especially with the Champs-√âlys√©es stretching out below. The experience is both inspiring and humbling, offering a unique perspective on the city‚Äôs beauty and history. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Paris!

An iconic and unforgettable experience! The Arc de Triomphe is stunning, offering incredible views of Paris from the top. Walking down the Champs-√âlys√©es, with its beautiful shops and vibrant atmosphere, makes for a perfect day in the heart of the city.

Great place to visit and see the whole of Paris. You can access the top of the arc and have a 360 degrees view of the whole of Paris. Absolutely stunning. The price for a ticket for an adult is ‚Ç¨16. You have to.climg the staircase to go all the way up so it is quite a lot of steps to climb but well worth it. If you get tired, you have enough space to stop, catch your breath and let other people pass by. Once you reach the top, you have access to a mini museum with the history of the arc de triomphe, a souvenir store and toilets. To see the view, climb one more floor up and enjoy the beauty of the city. You can spend as much time there as you want, take lots of photos and enjoy the view. Really well worth it. To come down, you go down another staircase. A few years ago, you would go up via a lift and use the staircase to go down. I think the elevator is only available now for handicapped or elderly people.

Very nice experience! Enjoyed taking photos and reading the historical information around the arc. I recommend taking the subway and walking to get there. Parking is awful, enjoy the walk and experience the beauty that Paris has to offer. Wear comfortable shoes tho. üëåüèΩ

Challenging climb up the roof so be ready to go up long narrow sprial staircase with no landings if you want to see the view from the top. View from above can be great at certain times. If it's foggy you might not see anything at all.

It is one of the must visit places in Paris. If you want to take good photos, make sure you go there early in the morning when the area is not still too busy. Otherwise during day, it is overcrowded. It is very beautiful and stunning.

Do NOT try to take pictures from the middle of the road. You can take good pictures from the barricades at the sidewalk close to the road. It's a grand arch & very impressive! The steps are steep & a bit of a workout to climb up but the view from the top is awesome! You have a great view over the city center and a good view of the Eiffel tower. Have your camera ready! ‚ò∫Ô∏è

A must. You go underground on the escalator to get there. Don‚Äôt cross the busy street! You join a queue and pay a small fee to go up the tower to the viewing platform. Take note of the stairs. You do wait a while to buy tickets. You can get a beautiful view of Paris and the Eiffel Tower. It‚Äôs stunning! We went mid afternoon - I think early morning might be better.

The Arc de Triomphe is a must-visit landmark in Paris. Its grand architecture and historical significance are awe-inspiring. Climbing to the top offers breathtaking panoramic views of the city, especially of the Champs-√âlys√©es. The attention to detail in the carvings is remarkable, reflecting France's rich history and dedication to honoring its heroes. Visiting at sunset is a magical experience, as the city lights start to sparkle. The surrounding area is vibrant, with cafes and shops adding to the charm. A truly unforgettable experience for history lovers and travelers alike!

This is one if not my favorite landmark in Paris. I love the Napoleonic era and this monument depict it at its finest. The architecture is amazing.  The fact that it immortalizes Napoleon's commanders and his army is remarkable. The interior of the arch is also great, and the French flag that flies in the center is incredible. Keep in mind that it is a good idea to buy tickets in advance, and if you have a valid journalist card with a photo - you will be able to enter without paying an entrance fee. The view from the roof of the arch is incredible. The souvenir shop has many interesting books that will tell you the history of the monument.

I visited the place for fireworks on New Year‚Äôs Eve. Lots of people. If you don‚Äôt like crowd you can always move around as you can see the fireworks from all angles. That‚Äôs what I did. You will really like it. A way to start the new years. You can also visit the top to get a view of the whole city from the top.

A beautiful landmark in Paris. Can't miss it. The place has attracted a large crowd. Some even stay in the middle of the road divider to get a best shot of the monument. There are tunnel entrance and exit that bypasses traffic to take visitors to the monument for a closeup. At night the monument is illuminated and less crowd.

Definitely a must if you go to Paris. Highly recommend to go all the way to the terrace The views are amazing. The only thing that didn't like was the fact that the lift wasn't working. Still very much worth going up

This has many options. One option is to get to the top. You can access underground so you don‚Äôt have to cross the busy street. Once underground you can purchase ticket. From there you can go to top which Includes awesome view of city including skyscrapers and the Eiffel Tower. Great for date night or for family. We met many people there. The staff speak English and French. Sunset view is amazing

One of my favorite places to see a 360 of Paris.  Just know that you will need to climb up 284 windy steps to see reach the top!   It‚Äôs also a fun way to stand in the middle of one of the largest roundabouts and watch the cars seamlessly navigate. January 2025 the admission cost was 16 euros

The wonderful Arc De Triomphe is well worth a visit. Tickets are available to go to the platform on the top. PLEASE DO NOT RISK YOUR LIFE CROSSING THE ROAD.( As we witnessed)  There is tunnel access to the Arc De Triomphe. Under the arc is the tomb of the unknown soldier. If you walk down the Champs de Elyse do look into some of the older arcades  they are beautiful.

An iconic landmark. It's much larger than I imagined . Be sure to visit the museum and veranda at the top of the spiral stair case. I had no idea how it almost wasn't completed, and the views from the top are beautiful and worth the 284 step climb.

A must-see in Paris! The design of the square is amazing, with the Arc as the centrepiece. Walk down the Champe Elise St and stop in the islands I. The middle of the street and look at the Arch, see how beautifully it stands at the end and shows off the history and story.

Me and my wife came to Paris for our honeymoon,  we chose Paris because I had been learning French for 2 years.  We definitely wanted to see the Champs Elesee. It's one of my favorite songs.  When we were dating, we saw a John Wick film that had a chase scene around the Arc de Triomphe. It was amazing to see it for real!  This is a beautiful building and piece of art. You've not really lived unless you've been to Paris ‚ô•Ô∏è

There is a tunnel entrance that we didn‚Äôt know about so we crossed the street that we weren‚Äôt supposed to. On the way out we followed the signs to be less dangerous. I‚Äôm not in the best shape but I made the way to the top. Thank god there‚Äôs a break at the top to the roof. It was cloudy but still nice enough. Once we did this we decided our tickets to Effiel weren‚Äôt worth the trouble. Line went quick enough. Buy tickets in advance from them directly. The area is great for shopping as well!

Beautiful architecture and history. Definitely a must see when in Paris. I love how they built a passage under the road to get to the center and other side so that you do not have to cross the very busy roundabout. Makes it very easy to access.

We had online tickets, but still we waited more than 30 minutes to go inside. The building looks majestic and huge! Once at the top, there is a huge hall with some history and facts. After accessing the roof, the view above the city is incredible. Worth visiting!

Beautiful night view of Paris. In the gift shop - bookstore we found the most pleasant and helpful and I am lacking words to describe them ladies who went above and beyond to help us. Ticket lady was also very pleasant and patient with our bunch of wrong tickets. Amazing view and amazing people. Merci, Hvala :)

Seeing all of Paris from the top of the Arc de Triomphe was an unforgettable experience. The breathtaking views of the Champs-√âlys√©es, the Eiffel Tower, and the city‚Äôs stunning layout made it truly special. A must-visit for incredible panoramas!

Got there nice and early so no issues with queuing and for January the views were not too bad considering the weather. I dropped one star thanks to the ridiculous security measures in place and the power hungry security people being unnecessarily rude to everyone.

What a view, beautiful and amazing structure with art work in the stone and after walking to the top (not for those that are faint hearted or unfit) you will be impressed with a stunning view. ‚Ç¨16 each adult is well worth the view and helps explain the planning of the city. Access to the roundabout center is an easy walk under the road. Very highly recommended.

This is an amazing monument in the centre of Paris city. I went here on a weekday early in the morning like 7:30 AM. There were guards but they didn‚Äôt ask me for any ticket. There is no need for a ticket to go to this monument but if you wish to go to the top of this monument you need a ticket. I am sure that you can buy this online but there is a possibility to buy a tickets onsite but queue to be expected. This has so much story to tell. I suggest take a guided tour. Commute, it is well connected to an underground metro line so worries there. To go to this place on the other hand is tricky. You might have to take a tunnel and climb a few steps down and a few steps back up again. No parking and no wheel chair access, loads of fancy designer shops nearby

A visit to Paris is incomplete without visiting the Arc de Triomphe. I love the 360 view of Paris from here. It isn‚Äôt too high, just perfect to grant you great views. I love the way all the roads around the monument line up. From here you can see landmarks such as Sacre Coeur, The Louvre, Eiffel Tower and many more. You will find the tomb of the unknown soldier here. Tickets are priced at ‚Ç¨16 as of November 2024. Tip: if you do not want to pay to go to the top, you can still visit the arch. Don‚Äôt stay in the queue for those wanting tickets. Just walk on to the right up flight of stairs. I guess you go the same if you have reserved tickets. There are a lot of stairs to climb to access the top. Don‚Äôt let anyone rush you. It says on your ticket that you have 45 minutes from the time of entering. There are security checks for those accessing the tower so be prepared. There are two levels before the terrace. There is a small exhibition area and gift shop on site. There are toilets as well. Do not attempt to access the arch by crossing the roundabout. Use the underground entrance. Also it is important to exercise caution where you take photos on the Champs-√âlys√©es. Observe opening and closing times.

We visited on the first Sunday of November, it‚Äôs free on every first Sunday until March 2025. It‚Äôs clearly stated on the website if anyone wants to further check.  It‚Äôs pretty beautiful at night when Eiffel Tower turns on the light, and I recommend to spend time upstairs to see the night view at least once.

There's an underground bridge, so you dont have to cut through traffic to get to it. If you want to get to the top, there's free entry for 18-25 EU residents and long-term EU residents (visa >4 months)! If that's not you but you still want to see the views from the top, I recommend purchasing tickets in advance. The ticket line moved quickly, but it would've been much faster if we already had our tickets. Great views. Be prepared for some stairs, though!! There is also an elevator for the elderly and disabled.

This is going to sound a little odd but the special part of the Arc is not the outside of the Arc itself, it's the interior and the stunning views you can get from the top. Try get tickets in advance for around sunset for the day you attend, providing the sky is clear you should get a great view. Be prepared to climb a lot of steps! There is a lift but is generally not available for most people. There are toilets available for those wondering. Well worth the visit if you visit Paris.

Been to see it physically before, which of course is breathtaking. However I decided to go up this time and it was worth every penny! Fantastic views of Paris in any direction you look. Well worth it - especially when you compare the entry admission to the Eiffel Tower which has seemingly become a rip off

A lot of steps + 13 euro ticket but it's worth it to go up! The line looks longer than it is, just 20 minutes to get through initial security and then you walk another 5-10. Great way to appreciate Paris with twelve major roads starring out in each direction, fantastic view of Tower and other attractions. Go just before sunset for cool photos and memorable views.

Simply stunning! We arrived by taxi and he told his to access you had to go underneath.  At first we got in the line for tickets but quickly realized you don‚Äôt need tickets to walk around the outside, only  if you want to climb to the top.  The monument in person is much more ornate and larger than I expected.  We walked home along the Champs Elysees which was lovely. I would highly recommend making a quick visit.
